newsitem.title: JAPAN: Daiwa says chosen to lead-manage S.Africa samurai.
newsitem.headline: Daiwa says chosen to lead-manage S.Africa samurai.

text.p: Daiwa Securities Co Ltd has been awarded the mandate by South Africa to lead-manage the country's latest planned samurai bond, an official at Daiwa said on Monday.
The Business Day newspaper in Johannesburg said earlier this month that South Africa had decided on a yen issue in June to kick off its four billion rand foreign borrowing programme.
South Africa last issued samurai bonds in 1995 and the amount was about 30 billion yen. At that time, Daiwa also acted as a lead-manager, underwriters said.
Underwriters here said they were unsure about the volume of the samurai because South Africa was also planning to issue U.S. dollar-denominated bonds at around the same time.
